task.summary: Default task

[REFACTOR] Migrate core registries and networking to Architectury API
This commit refactors a significant portion of the mod's infrastructure from Fabric API to the Architectury API to support multi-loader builds.
- [REFACTOR] Migrated Item, Block, Sound, Entity, and ScreenHandler registries to use Architectury's DeferredRegister system. - [REFACTOR] Replaced Fabric Networking API with Architectury's NetworkManager, centralizing packet registration and handling into a new `ModPackets` class. - [REFACTOR] Replaced Fabric event listeners (`CommandRegistrationCallback`, `PlayerEvent`) with their Architectury equivalents. - [REFACTOR] Replaced Fabric's `CompostingChanceRegistry` helper with direct calls to the vanilla `ComposterBlock` map, triggered by an Architectury `LifecycleEvent`. - [REFACTOR] Updated world generation to use Architectury's `BiomeModifications` API instead of Fabric's. - [CHORE] Consolidated biome-checking logic into `ModEntitySpawns` to act as a single source of truth.

[FIX] Implement @ExpectPlatform for spawn restrictions
Replaces the Fabric-only spawn restriction logic with a cross-platform @ExpectPlatform bridge, ensuring compatibility with NeoForge.
- Adds the common `ModSpawnPlacements` class with the `@ExpectPlatform` method. - Implements the Fabric-specific version in `fabric/.../ModSpawnPlacementsImpl.java` using `SpawnRestriction.register`. - Implements the NeoForge-specific version in `neoforge/.../ModSpawnPlacementsImpl.java` using the `RegisterSpawnPlacementsEvent`. - Updates the main NeoForge entrypoint to correctly register the event listener to the mod event bus.

[REFACTOR] Finalize common module and fix build crashes
This commit completes the major refactoring of the common module, resolving the final build crashes.
- Replaced the Fabric-only AttachmentType system with a vanilla DataTracker on PlayerEntity for shoulder-riding, mimicking the vanilla parrot implementation. - Refactored all `getAttached`/`setAttached` calls in `HamsterEntity`, `PlayerEntityMixin`, and `HamsterShoulderFeatureRenderer` to use the new DataTracker system. - Replaced the client-side `HamsterRenderState` attachment with a server-side `HamsterRenderTracker` utility to manage footstep sounds in a cross-platform way. - Moved all datagen provider classes into the `common` module and configured the build script to make the Fabric API available only for that task. - Cleaned up all remaining Fabric API imports from the common module.

[REFACTOR] Finalize common module and fix build crashes
This commit completes the major refactoring of the common module, resolving the final build crashes.
- Replaced the Fabric-only AttachmentType system with a vanilla DataTracker on PlayerEntity for shoulder-riding, mimicking the vanilla parrot implementation. - Refactored all `getAttached`/`setAttached` calls in `HamsterEntity`, `PlayerEntityMixin`, and `HamsterShoulderFeatureRenderer` to use the new DataTracker system. - Replaced the client-side `HamsterRenderState` attachment with a server-side `HamsterRenderTracker` utility to manage footstep sounds in a cross-platform way. - Moved all datagen provider classes into the `common` module and configured the build script to make the Fabric API available only for that task. - Cleaned up all remaining Fabric API imports from the common module.

[REFACTOR] Implement @ExpectPlatform and centralize datagen
This commit completes the migration of platform-specific APIs to cross-platform solutions using Architectury's @ExpectPlatform bridge and centralizes the data generation process into the common module.
- Replaced the Fabric-specific spawn restriction logic with an @ExpectPlatform bridge in `common/world/ModSpawnPlacements.java`. - Provided platform-specific implementations for spawn restrictions in `fabric/world/fabric` and `neoforge/world/neoforge`. - Moved all data generation provider classes from the `fabric` module to the `common` module. - Configured the `common/build.gradle` to include Fabric API as a compile-time dependency for the `runDatagen` task.

[REFACTOR] Implement @ExpectPlatform and centralize datagen
This commit completes the migration of platform-specific APIs to cross-platform solutions using Architectury's @ExpectPlatform bridge and centralizes the data generation process into the common module.
- Replaced the Fabric-specific spawn restriction logic with an @ExpectPlatform bridge in `common/world/ModSpawnPlacements.java`. - Provided platform-specific implementations for spawn restrictions in `fabric/world/fabric` and `neoforge/world/neoforge`. - Moved all data generation provider classes from the `fabric` module to the `common` module. - Configured the `common/build.gradle` to include Fabric API as a compile-time dependency for the `runDatagen` task.

[CHORE] Prepare for shared initializer refactor
This commit includes minor build script and code cleanup in preparation for refactoring the mod's initialization sequence. The data generation process is still failing, but the codebase is now in a stable state to attempt a fix.
- [FIX] Corrected a `NoClassDefFoundError` during datagen by adding necessary mod dependencies to the `common/build.gradle` datagen classpath.
The next step is to create a shared initializer that can be called by both the runtime and datagen entrypoints to resolve the `IllegalStateException: This registry can't create intrusive holders` error.
[CHORE] Prepare for split initializer refactor
[CHORE] Prepare for moving datagen back to the fabric module
[REFACTOR] Moved datagen back to the fabric module, by reverting to previous commit.
[REFACTOR] Moved datagen back to the fabric module, by reverting to previous commit.
[CHORE] Preparing to remove datagen. Considering manual resource generation using AI.

[FIX] Attempt to resolve Architectury @ExpectPlatform crash
This commit includes several changes aimed at fixing the AssertionError crash during Fabric client launch and addressing mixin load errors.
- [FIX] Corrected an IllegalClassLoadError by moving the PlayerEntityAccessor interface out of the mixin package and into a dedicated `accessor` package to prevent direct referencing from non-mixin code. - [REF] Updated PlayerEntityMixin to implement the relocated accessor interface, providing the proper link for the mixin system. - [FIX] Updated HamsterShoulderFeatureRenderer to use the safe accessor interface instead of an illegal direct cast to the mixin class. - [CHORE] The build still fails with an AssertionError, indicating the platform-specific implementation for ModSpawnPlacements is not being used. Pushing this state to the repository for community review.

[FIX] Attempt to resolve Architectury @ExpectPlatform crash
This commit includes several changes aimed at fixing the AssertionError crash during Fabric client launch and addressing mixin load errors.
- [FIX] Removed `architectury {compileOnly()}` from root/build.gradle` - [REF] Updated file structure in fabric module.
Pushing this state to the repository for community review.

[FIX] Attempt to resolve Architectury @ExpectPlatform crash
This commit includes several changes aimed at fixing the AssertionError crash during Fabric client launch and addressing mixin load errors.
- [FIX] Updated abric/build.gradle shadowJar block.
Pushing this state to the repository for community review.

[FIX] Attempt to resolve Architectury @ExpectPlatform crash
This commit includes several changes aimed at fixing the AssertionError crash during Fabric client launch and addressing mixin load errors.
- [FIX] Updated abric/build.gradle shadowJar block.
Pushing this state to the repository for community review.

[REFACTOR] Complete migration to Architectury multi-loader structure
This commit finalizes the full migration of the project from a Fabric-only setup to a modern Architectury workspace, enabling multi-loader support for Fabric (still need to test NeoForge).
- [FIX] Resolved a cascade of build script and classpath errors, including `ClassNotFoundException` for entrypoints and `AssertionError` on `@ExpectPlatform` stubs. - [FIX] Corrected the Gradle build process to produce a valid, non-empty JAR file for distribution.

[FIX] Resolve mixin-related crashes and improve AI state handling
This session addresses several critical crashes caused by illegal mixin classloading and refines AI behavior, particularly for the new sulking state. It also adds a dynamic messaging system for the ore-seeking feature.
- [FIX] Corrected `IllegalClassLoadError` crashes by replacing direct casts to `PlayerEntityMixin` with the `PlayerEntityAccessor` interface in `HamsterEntity` and `AdorableHamsterPetsClient`. - [REF] Centralized AI interruption logic by updating `HamsterEntity.isSitting()` to include the sulking state. This prevents goals like `TemptGoal`, `FollowOwnerGoal`, `MeleeAttackGoal`, and `MateGoal` from running while a hamster is sulking. - [FEAT] Implemented a dynamic messaging system for when a hamster finds gold ore. The first occurrence per player shows a unique message, with subsequent occurrences randomly selecting from a pool of alternatives, avoiding immediate repeats. - [FEAT] Added a new advancement and player NBT data to track the first-time gold discovery and the last message shown. - [STYLE] Increased the volume of the looping hamster cleaning sound for better audibility.
[CHORE] Pushing to GitHub so Deep Research can access
[CHORE] Pushing to GitHub so Deep Research can access

[CHORE] Prepare for Neoforge testing
This commit focuses on critical server-side compatibility fixes, quality-of-life improvements, and polishing the ore-seeking feature.
- [FIX] Resolved multiple server crashes by correctly separating client/server logic for packet registration, item interactions, and keyframe events. - [FIX] Prevented AI goals from activating during the hamster's sulking state. - [FEAT] Added a config option for the gold ore "mistake" chance. - [FEAT] Added a startled jump and multiple new messages to the gold-finding event. - [STYLE] Adjusted hamster model scale, shoulder position, and various sound effect volumes.
[CHORE] Pushing to GitHub so Deep Research can access
[CHORE] Pushing to GitHub so Deep Research can access
[CHORE] Pushing to GitHub so Deep Research can access
[CHORE] Pushing to GitHub so Deep Research can access
[CHORE] Pushing to GitHub so Deep Research can access

[FEAT] Enable NeoForge support via Architectury refactor
This commit finalizes the migration to the Architectury toolchain, enabling the mod to be built for both Fabric and NeoForge.
- [FEAT] Refactored the entire mod from a Fabric-only structure to a common/multi-loader Architectury project. - [FEAT] Implemented native NeoForge event handlers for client-side registrations (renderers, model layers, screens) to ensure cross-platform compatibility. - [FIX] Resolved numerous loader-timing crashes on NeoForge related to registries, renderers, and creative tab population. - [FIX] Replaced a Fabric-specific access widener with a cross-platform Mixin Accessor for the hamster's melee attack goal. - [FIX] Corrected the NeoForge build script to properly bundle data-generated resources and Mixin configurations from the common module. - [FIX] Disabled the cleaning animation and sound for hamsters that are in a knocked-out state. - [DOC] Finalized the changelog for the v2.0.0 release.
- [DOC] Updated README.md
- [CHORE] Upload to repo for AI research

[FIX] Resolve hamster spawning on NeoForge
- Replaced the non-functional Architectury BiomeModifications API call on NeoForge with a data-driven biome_modifier JSON. - Created a custom BiomeModifier implementation (`ConfigurableHamsterSpawnModifier`) to allow spawn weights and counts to be controlled by the server config at runtime. - This aligns with the modern NeoForge data-driven worldgen pipeline and resolves the issue where hamsters were not spawning.

[FIX] Correct multiple minor behavior bugs, prepare for adding Forge
- Prevented wild hamsters from entering the cleaning state while sleeping by adding an isTamed() check to the cleaning logic. - Fixed an issue where the cleaning sound and state could become stuck if a player commanded a hamster to stand up mid-animation. - Added configurable options for cheese nutrition and saturation values, allowing server owners to balance food stats. - Updated the cheese item's tooltip to dynamically display the configured hunger and saturation values.
[CHORE] Add .gitignore to exclude build artifacts

[DOC] Update LICENSE.md and README.md
(cherry picked from commit bc870215a1e252226ab13a3dd17f87315d256ad5)
